chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?
items.plainText: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?

items.text: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?
items.plainText: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?

items.text: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?
items.plainText: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?

items.text: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?
items.plainText: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?

items.text: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?
items.plainText: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?

items.text: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?
items.plainText: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?

items.text: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?
items.plainText: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?

items.text: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.
items.plainText: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.

items.text: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?
items.plainText: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?

items.text: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?
items.plainText: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?

items.text: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.
items.plainText: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.

items.text: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.
items.plainText: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.

items.text: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?
items.plainText: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?

items.text: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.
items.plainText: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.

items.text: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.
items.plainText: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.

items.text: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.
items.plainText: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

items.text: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.
items.plainText: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.

items.text: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
items.plainText: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

items.text: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.
items.plainText: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.

items.text: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.
items.plainText: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.

items.text: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.
items.plainText: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.

items.text: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.
items.plainText: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.

items.text: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.
items.plainText: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.

items.text: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.
items.plainText: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.

items.text: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.
items.plainText: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.

items.text: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.
items.plainText: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.

items.text: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.
items.plainText: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.

items.text: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.
items.plainText: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.

items.text: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.
items.plainText: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.

items.text: Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.
items.plainText: Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.

items.text: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.
items.plainText: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.

items.text: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.
items.plainText: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.

items.text: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.
items.plainText: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.

items.text: He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.
items.plainText: He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.
